properties.name: Multitouch joystick example
properties.description: Demonstrate how to use a multitouch joystick and buttons.

events.comment: This action should be run every frame
Mouse controls must only be active when a touchscreen is not detected (because touches will trigger the mouse events)
Left joystick controls the direction the ship is facing and how fast it travels in that direction.
This action should be run every frame

events.name: Disable anchor behavior when joystick is pressed (only required if "floating" is enabled)

events.comment: Mouse controls must only be active when a touchscreen is not detected (because touches will trigger the mouse events)

events.name: If mouse is pressed, press the joystick on the same side as mouse cursor
Release both joysticks when mouse is released
Release joystick when moving cursor to the opposite side of screen

events.comment: Cursor on LEFT side of screen
Cursor on RIGHT side of screen
Movement is controlled by left joystick
Rotation is controlled by right joystick
Fire bullets in the direction the ship is facing and set bullet speed to a static value plus the speed the ship is moving
This action should be run every frame
Mouse controls must only be active when a touchscreen is not detected (to prevent touch from triggering mouse events)
Left stick controls the direction the ship will move
Ship will rotate towards the angle of movement
Shoot standard bullets
Explode bullets around ship in a circle
Use the BulletCounter variable to set the angle each bullet will travel
Reset tint
Create background stars (the quantity is based on the width of the screen)
Add navigation buttons

events.name: Only show buttons when the mouse is over them

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Users can interact with the multitouch joystick to specify angle and force values.  These values can be used to control other objects in the scene such as movement and rotation, such as for twin-stick shooter games.

Mulitouch buttons can be used whenever a game allows the user to press multiple locations at once.

How to use:

- Add the joystick behavior to a sprite that will be the joystick 
- Place the joystick object on the scene
- Run the "Activate joystick" action on every frame and specify the thumb object
- The joystick thumb object will automatically be created and moved

Tips:

- Use "Simulate a touch" functions to provide mouse and gamepad controls
- More than one joystick or button can be used at the same time
- Joystick and thumb objects should have all sides the same length
- Thumb object must be smaller than the joystick object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MultitouchJoystick
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Activate a joystick or buttons that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Activate a joystick that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MultitouchJoystick

events.comment: Reset "released" every frame

eventsFunctions.description: Activate multitouch joystick.
eventsFunctions.name: ActivateJoystick
eventsFunctions.sentence: Activate joystick _PARAM0_ using _PARAM2_ as the thumbstick

events.comment: Create joystick thumb and link it to the joystick
Detect new touch on joystick
Move thumb back to center
Reset values (except for angle, which stays the same)
Detect if joystick has a valid TouchID
Record joystick angle
Record distance to touch
Calculate the percent of distance the thumb has moved from the center of joystick.

events.name: Move thumb based on joystick values

events.comment: Move thumb back to center when not being pressed (acts like a spring on a real controller)
Move joystick thumb when a touch is active
If floating is enabled, move joystick to keep touch inside
Touch is outside joystick
Move joystick thumb to the location of the touch (but stay inside joystick)

eventsFunctions.description: Percentage the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, axis force, trigger pressure, deadzone for each gamepad, etc...

Up to 4 gamepads can be connected. For each condition or expression, you'll have to enter the index of the gamepad to read. This is 1, 2, 3 or 4.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of the pressure on a gamepad trigger.
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerPressure

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the force value of a gamepad stick.
0 is stick on default position, 1 is at the maximum.
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the rotation value of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
eventsFunctions.name: StickRotationValue

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of axis of a gamepad stick.
eventsFunctions.name: AxisValue

eventsFunctions.description:
Test if a button is released on a gamepad. Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_released

eventsFunctions.description: Return the index of the last pressed button of a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonID

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Any_Button_pressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description:
Return the last button pressed. 
Buttons for Xbox and PS4 can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Both: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".
eventsFunctions.name: LastButtonString

eventsFunctions.description:
Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad. 
Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".
eventsFunctions.name: C_Button_pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of the deadzone applied to a gamepad sticks, between 0 and 1.
eventsFunctions.name: Deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Set the deadzone for sticks of the gamepad. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved). Deadzone is between 0 and 1, and is by default 0.2.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Set_deadzone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set deadzone for sticks on gamepad: _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.description: Deadzone for sticks, 0.2 by default (0 to 1)
parameters.name: deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a stick of a gamepad is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Axis_pushed
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM2_ stick of gamepad _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the number of connected gamepads.
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectedGamepadsCount

eventsFunctions.description: Return a string containing informations about the specified gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: GamepadType

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified gamepad has the specified information in its description. Useful to know if the gamepad is a Xbox or PS4 controller.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_type

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a gamepad is connected.
eventsFunctions.name: C_Controller_X_is_connected

eventsFunctions.description: Generate a vibration on the specified controller. Might only work if the game is running in a recent web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Vibrate_controller

parameters.description: Time of the vibration, in seconds (optional, default value is 1)
parameters.name: duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if any button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: C_any_button_released
eventsFunctions.sentence: Any button of gamepad _PARAM1_ is released

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

parameters: min(max(Object.X(), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 + Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginLeft()), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Width() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginRight())

min(max(Object.Y(), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2+ Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginTop()), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Height() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginBottom())
